One should know the defilements, and also know from where the defilements arise, also know the calamities received from the defilements, also know the distribution of the defilements, also know the extinction of the defilements, also know the practice to be undertaken for the extinction of the defilements.

One should know suffering, also know the origin of suffering, also know the suffering received from suffering, also know the distribution of suffering, also know the cessation of suffering, also know the practice to be undertaken for the cessation of suffering.
Bhikkhus!

One should know the effluents, also know the origin of the effluents, also know the suffering received from the effluents, also know the distribution of the effluents, also know the cessation of the effluents, also know the practice to be undertaken for the cessation of the effluents.
What is meant by knowing the defilements?
It means there are three defilements:
First, the defilement of desire; second, the defilement of existence; third, the defilement of ignorance;
This is meant by knowing the defilements.
What is meant by knowing the origin of the defilements?
It means ignorance is the root of the defilements, from which they arise;
This is meant by knowing the origin of the defilements.
What is meant by knowing the suffering resulting from the defilements?
It means from the practice of ignorance, one's actions accord with it, and the suffering one receives is also in accordance with one's actions, either falling into a good realm or an evil realm;
This is meant by knowing the suffering resulting from the defilements.
What is meant by knowing the distribution of the defilements?

It means falling into hell is a different kind of action, falling into the realm of animals is a different kind of action, falling into the realm of hungry ghosts is a different kind of action, falling into the heavenly realm is a different kind of action, falling into the human realm is a different kind of action;
This is meant by knowing the distribution of the defilements.
What is meant by knowing the extinction of the defilements?
It means that when delusion is exhausted, defilements are exhausted, and so are afflictions.
This is how to know the exhaustion of defilements.
What is the practice to be known for the end of defilements?
It is the eightfold path:
Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.
This is the practice to be known for the end of defilements.

One should know pain, one should also know the origin of pain, one should also know the suffering of receiving pain, one should also know the distribution of pain, one should also know the cessation of pain, one should also know the practice to be undertaken to bring pain to an end.
What is meant by 'one should know pain'?
It is said there are three kinds of pain:
One is pleasant pain, two is painful pain, three is neither pleasant nor painful pain;
This is called knowing pain.
What is meant by 'one should know the origin of pain'?
It is said it originates from thought;
This is called knowing the origin of pain.
What is meant by 'one should know the suffering of receiving pain'?
It is said that what is thought is suffering;
This is called knowing the suffering of receiving pain.

You should know thoughts, you should know the origin of thoughts, you should know the danger in thoughts, you should know the abandoning of thoughts, and you should know the practice leading to the end of thoughts.
What is meant by knowing thoughts?
There are four kinds of thoughts:
First, having few thoughts, second, having many thoughts, third, having immeasurable thoughts, fourth, having no thoughts of non-use;
This is called knowing thoughts.
What is meant by knowing the origin of thoughts?
It is said that thoughts arise from the mind;
This is called knowing the origin of thoughts.
What is meant by knowing the retribution received from thoughts?
It is said that as thoughts are, so they are practiced, this is called practice;
This is called knowing the retribution received from thoughts.
What is meant by knowing the classification of thoughts?

It is said that thoughts of form are different, thoughts of sound are also different, thoughts of smell are also different, thoughts of taste are also different, thoughts of physical sensations are also different;
This is called knowing the classification of thoughts.
What is meant by knowing the cessation of thoughts?
It is said that when thoughts are exhausted, thoughts cease;
This is called knowing the cessation of thoughts.
What is the practice to be known for the completion of thought?
It is the eightfold path:
Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration;
This is the practice to be known for the completion of thought.

Bhiká¹£us, having known thought in this way, having known the origin of thought in this way, having known the danger in thought in this way, having known the distribution of thought in this way, having known the cessation of thought in this way, having known the practice to be undertaken for the completion of thought in this way, it is called the bhiká¹£u's renunciation of the world, the practice of purity, and the attainment of the path for the completion of thought.

One should know desire, also know the origin of desire, also know the suffering brought about by desire, also know the distribution of desire, also know the cessation of desire, also know the practice to be undertaken to end desire.
What is meant by knowing desire?
It refers to the five kinds of desires: the desire to obtain, the desire to have in one's heart, the desire to love, the desire to take what is desirable as one's own.
What are the five?
First, the desire for visible forms that can be seen by the eyes, the desire to obtain, the desire to have in one's heart, the desire to love, the desire to take what is desirable as one's own;
Second, the desire for sounds that can be heard by the ears, the desire to obtain, the desire to have in one's heart, the desire to love, the desire to take what is desirable as one's own;
Third, the desire for smells that can be smelled by the nose, the desire to obtain, the desire to have in one's heart, the desire to love, the desire to take what is desirable as one's own;
Fourth, the desire for tastes that can be experienced by the mouth, the desire to obtain, the desire to have in one's heart, the desire to love, the desire to take what is desirable as one's own;

Fifth, the body obtains coarseness and subtlety, and further knows the desire to obtain desire, the desire that is most in the mind, the desire to love form, and the desire to greedily approach what is desirable;
In this way, it is known as loving desire.
What is meant by knowing the origin of loving desire?
It is said to be thinking from the beginning;
In this way, it is known as the origin of loving desire.
What is meant by knowing the suffering received from loving desire?

If one is already born from what is loved and desired, one gives rise to the thought of contention, waits for the direction, and waits for the calamity, and then thinks of waiting for the calamity, and then attains the calamity according to this, whether in a good place or a bad place;
In this way, it is known as the suffering received from loving desire.
What is meant by knowing the distribution of loving desire?

It is said that the desire for form is different, the desire for sound is also different, the desire for smell is also different, the desire for taste is also different, and the desire for the coarse and subtle of bodily sensations is also different;
In this way, it is known as the distribution of loving desire.
What is meant by knowing the end of loving desire?
It means that when thoughts are exhausted, craving is extinguished.
This is how to know the exhaustion of craving.
What is the practice to be known for the end of craving?
It is the eightfold path:
Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.
This is the practice to be known for the end of craving.

you already know craving like this, know its origin like this, know its cessation like this, know the practice leading to its cessation like this, then this is called a bhiká¹£u who is disgusted with the world, whose practice is pure, who has attained the path, and for whom craving has ended.
Bhiká¹£us!

One should know the activities, one should know the origin of activities, one should know the retribution of good and bad karma from activities, one should know the distribution of activities, one should know the cessation of activities, and one should know which activities to practice to end activities.
What is meant by knowing activities?
It refers to thoughts and intentions, not being apart from them, this is activity;
This is knowing activities.
What is meant by knowing the origin of activities?
It refers to having desires and attachments, having the basis of activities from desires;
This is knowing the origin of activities.
What is meant by knowing the retribution of good and bad karma from activities?
It refers to having black activities, leading to black misfortune and falling down;
Having pure and white activities, leading to pure and white blessings and ascending higher;
This is knowing the retribution of good and bad karma from activities.
What is meant by knowing the distribution of activities?
It refers to having black activities, receiving misfortune from black activities;
Having pure and white activities, receiving pure and white blessings from pure and white activities;
There are black and white actions that lead to black and white misfortune and blessings;
There are also neither black nor pure white actions that lead to receiving blessings from this;
The practice is exhausted, and so it is known as the distribution of practice.
What is meant by knowing the exhaustion of practice?
It means that when craving is exhausted, practice is exhausted;
It is like this that the exhaustion of practice is known.
What is meant by knowing the practice to be undertaken in order to complete practice?
It refers to the eightfold noble path:
First, right view; second, right thought; third, right speech; fourth, right action; fifth, right livelihood; sixth, right effort; seventh, right mindfulness; eighth, right concentration;
It is like this that the practice to be undertaken in order to complete practice is known.

The bhiká¹£us already know the practice like this, know the practice has its origin like this, know the practice receives retribution like this, know the practice is distributed like this, know the practice ends like this, know the practice to be practiced to end the practice like this, this is called the bhiká¹£us regretting and despising the world, practicing purity, attaining the path to end the practice.

You should know suffering, and also know the origin of suffering, also know the retribution of suffering, also know the distribution of suffering, also know the end of suffering, also know the practice to be practiced to end suffering.
What is meant by knowing suffering?

It means knowing birth is suffering, knowing old age is suffering, knowing sickness is suffering, knowing death is suffering, knowing not getting what one wants is suffering, knowing separation from what one loves is suffering, knowing not getting what one seeks is suffering, knowing the five aggregates are suffering;
This is knowing suffering.
What is meant by knowing the suffering from its origin?
It means that ignorance is the root of suffering.
This is how to know the suffering from its origin.
What is meant by knowing the suffering from receiving retribution?
It means that ignorant, unenlightened people in the world experience even more intense and unbearable suffering in their bodies. They should contemplate cutting off [ignorance] from this.

They seek externally, thinking there is something external to rely on. this is how to know the suffering from receiving retribution.
What is meant by knowing the distribution of suffering?

It means there is suffering with little retribution lasting long, or suffering with little retribution quickly resolved, or suffering with much retribution lasting long, or suffering with much retribution quickly resolved;
This is how to know the distribution of suffering.
What is to be known as the end of suffering?
It is said that when delusion is exhausted, suffering is exhausted;
This is how to know the end of suffering.
What is to be known as the practice to be undertaken to end suffering?
It is the eightfold path:
Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration;
This is how to know the practice to be undertaken to end suffering.
